author: jens.masslich@tag24.de (Jens Maßlich)
title: Dank legendärer Ausbildung: Dynamo-Pechvogel Grill lässt sich nicht unterkriegen
text:
Dank legendärer Ausbildung: Dynamo-Pechvogel Grill lässt sich nicht unterkriegen
Dresden - Er kann einem fast schon ein wenig leidtun. Den einen oder anderen spöttischen Kommentar von Anhängern seiner Ex-Klubs gab's bereits zur Verpflichtung, und in zweimal 45 Minuten musste Lennart Grill (26) bei Dynamos Testspielen schon sechsmal hinter sich greifen.
"Alle elf Spieler sind verantwortlich, dass wir keine Gegentore kriegen. Und alle elf sind verantwortlich, dass wir Tore schießen. Von daher trägt immer jeder seinen Teil dazu bei", nimmt SGD-Coach Thomas Stamm (42) den neuen Keeper mehr oder weniger in Schutz: "Es ist natürlich hart, wenn du so reinkommst. Wenn du dann in dem Sinne nichts dafür kannst, vielleicht auch gar nicht die Möglichkeit hast, den einen oder anderen Ball zu halten, das kann ich verstehen. Aber das gehört dazu."
Tatsächlich konnte Grill bei den vier Gegentoren binnen 18 Minuten in Prag und den zwei am Sonntag gegen den VfL Wolfsburg nur wenig ausrichten.
Schwaches Zweikampfverhalten der Männer davor war eher ausschlaggebend, auch wenn der zweite Wölfe-Treffer wohl eher ein Eigentor war. Zuvor noch richtig stark pariert, sprang der zweite Ball von Vaclav Cerny (27) über den Umweg Pfosten an Grills Knie ins Tor - eine passende Zustandsbeschreibung zum Einstand des 26-Jährigen im Konkurrenzkampf um das Dynamo-Tor.
"Das Wichtigste ist, erst einmal reinzukommen, alles kennenzulernen, die Abläufe und die Jungs. Dann schauen wir, für wie viel es reicht", erklärte Grill nach seiner ersten Woche bei der SGD.
Lennart Grill stammt aus der legendären Torwartschule von Gerry Ehrmann
Der Torhüter hat bereits Erst- und Zweitliga-Erfahrung gesammelt, soll der bisherigen Nummer eins Tim Schreiber (23) im Konkurrenzkampf einheizen.
Der kennt die 2. Bundesliga noch nicht und fehlte zuletzt im Training sowie bei den Testspielen angeschlagen. "Am Ende kann nur einer spielen. Von daher sind wir auf der einen Seite natürlich Konkurrenten", gibt der Neuzugang zu.
"Auf der anderen Seite sind mittlerweile die Zeiten von Oliver Kahn und Jens Lehmann vorbei, dass man sich jetzt das Schlimmste wünscht. Im Endeffekt geht es darum, dass wir mit der Mannschaft den größtmöglichen Erfolg haben. Da hilft es jedem, wenn wir uns im Torwartteam pushen."
Auch wenn es bisher - und in den vergangenen Jahren nach einem steilen Aufstieg - nicht so lief wie erhofft, Grill lässt sich seine positive Grundeinstellung nicht nehmen. Einer der vielen Aspekte, die er aus der (fast schon legendären) Torwartschule von Gerry Ehrmann (66) in Kaiserslautern mitgenommen hat.
Grill: "Gerry und auch nahezu alle Torhüter, die da rauskamen, sind eigentlich bekannt für eine gewisse mentale Stärke. Da kann viel passieren, und da wirft einen nichts um."
Titelfoto: Bildmontage: IMAGO/CTK Photo, IMAGO/Jan Hübner

author: lepoint.fr
title: États-Unis : les salariés de Boeing votent une grève à une écrasante majorité
text:
--> N ouveau coup dur pour Boeing. Déjà en difficulté, l'avionneur américain fait face à une grève de ses machinistes de l'usine de la région de Seattle, aux États-Unis, ce vendredi 13 septembre. Cette grève a été votée la veille au soir à 96 % après le rejet massif de la nouvelle convention collective à 94,6 %, a précisé Jon Holden, président du syndicat des machinistes IAM-District 751. « Nous ferons grève à minuit », a-t-il ajouté.
La newsletter Économie Tous les jeudis à 17h
Recevez le meilleur de l’actualité économique.
Votre adresse email Votre adresse email n'est pas valide
Veuillez renseigner votre adresse email
Merci !
Votre inscription a bien été prise en compte avec l'adresse email :
Pour découvrir toutes nos autres newsletters, rendez-vous ici : MonCompte
En vous inscrivant, vous acceptez les conditions générales d’utilisations et notre politique de confidentialité .
« Nos membres se sont exprimés haut et fort ce soir », a affirmé Jon Holden, dont le syndicat qui représente environ 33 000 travailleurs dans la région Nord-Ouest Pacifique, avait initialement soutenu l'accord. Le syndicaliste avait auparavant déclaré ne pas pouvoir « garantir que nous obtiendrons davantage en faisant grève ». À LIRE AUSSI Boeing 737 : l'avion tirelire devenu cauchemar pour son constructeur
La grève entraînera la fermeture de deux grandes usines d'assemblage d'avions dans la région de Puget Sound – les deux tiers des votes étaient nécessaires pour lancer un arrêt de travail dès l'expiration jeudi à minuit de la convention actuelle, vieille de 16 ans. Elle va paralyser la production du 737, du 777 et du 767 cargo, dont les livraisons cumulent déjà les retards . Une situation d'autant plus problématique que l'avionneur encaisse la plus grosse partie du paiement (environ 60 %) à la remise des avions.
Boeing « engagé » dans les négociations En dépit du vote massif en faveur de la grève, le groupe Boeing a déclaré dans un communiqué être « engagé » dans la négociation. « Nous restons déterminés à rétablir nos relations avec nos employés et le syndicat, et nous sommes prêts à retourner à la table des négociations pour parvenir à un nouvel accord », a affirmé l'avionneur. Selon les analystes de TD Cowen, une grève de 50 jours priverait Boeing de 3 à 3,5 milliards de dollars de liquidités et aurait un impact de 5,5 milliards sur le chiffre d'affaires. À LIRE AUSSI Faut-il avoir peur de voler dans des avions Boeing ?
Le vote de jeudi marque un rejet décisif d'un accord qui, selon les travailleurs, était bien moins généreux que ne l'affirmaient les dirigeants de Boeing. Cette nouvelle convention, qui concerne les adhérents de l'IAM dans la région de Seattle, prévoyait une hausse salariale de 25 % sur quatre ans ainsi qu'un engagement d'investissements dans la région. Et aussi la construction du prochain avion – annoncé pour 2035 – dans le berceau historique de l'avionneur qui devait assurer des emplois pour plusieurs décennies.
Dernière grève en 2008 Boeing espérait que ces concessions suffiraient à esquiver une grève, alors que sa situation financière est précaire depuis le crash de deux 737 MAX 8 en 2018 et en 2019, qui ont coûté la vie à 346 personnes, et une multitude de problèmes de qualité de la production .
« Ce n'est un secret pour personne : notre activité traverse une période difficile, en partie à cause de nos propres erreurs du passé. […] Une grève mettrait en péril notre reprise commune », avait prévenu mercredi soir Kelly Ortberg, qui a succédé le 8 août à Dave Calhoun au poste de directeur général de l'avionneur américain. Il avait exhorté les employés à ne pas « sacrifier » les progrès futurs en raison de « frustrations liées au passé ». Mais les mécontents jugent la hausse salariale trop éloignée des demandes du syndicat (+ 40 % initialement) et le volet sur les retraites insatisfaisant.
Après des grèves dans les secteurs de l'automobile, du divertissement et d'autres secteurs d'activité, les syndicats engagent ainsi un nouveau bras de fer. Le règlement de l'IAM prévoit que les grévistes reçoivent 250 dollars par semaine à partir de la troisième semaine d'arrêt de travail. La dernière grève chez l'avionneur américain remonte à 2008 et avait duré 57 jours.
Une semaine après sa prise de fonction, Kelly Ortberg s'était engagé à « réinitialiser » la relation avec l'IAM. Mais à la lecture de l'accord, de nombreux syndiqués ont réagi négativement et plaidé pour un arrêt de travail. « On nous a bradés », a lancé jeudi à l'Agence France-Presse Kamie Bryan, employée chez Boeing depuis 18 ans, après avoir voté contre l'accord et pour la grève. « Nous ne devrions pas prendre ces quelques sous qu'ils nous donnent et être reconnaissants », a-t-elle relevé, insistant sur l'ampleur des « revenus du patron ».
Les mots-clés associés à cet article États-Unis À ne pas manquer États-Unis : un avion atterrit d’urgence après la perte d’un hublot en plein vol Pourquoi Airbus ne profite pas des soucis de Boeing ? Signaler un contenu abusif

Publier mon commentaire Commentaires (5) claudev 16-09-2024 • 08h55 En 2023 l'ancien PDG David Calhoun a touché 32, 8 Millions de Dollars, en 2022 22, 5 Millions de Dollars, 45, 8% de progression en plein crise, on peut comprendre que les salariés soient en colère
Lire plus Signaler guy bernard 15-09-2024 • 12h43 Les americains ont une particularité dangereuse pour eux, c'est que leurs compétences scientifiques les plus pointues sont drainées par le monde de la finance qui offre des salaires exorbitants que ne peut se permettre l'industrie.
Des lors, le secteur connaît une crise de compétences, et surtout d'éthique professionnelle qui est le stade supérieur et inhérent à la maitrise parfaite de ses sujets.
Mon fils sort de Centrale et voulait rejoindre ses copains chez Goldman, mon neveu américain avait fait Yale et avait travaillé chez Goldman, et tout deux ont fait un choix moral qui les ont amené à réussir ailleurs.
J'ai enseigné la gestion, mais mon sujet principal n'est pas le chiffre, mais l'homme ; Condorcet aussi a développé en son temps le cout/bénéfice, mais il insistait sur l'homme, son éducation et sa finalité dans la societe.
Et en management stratégique le point de départ est une somme de compétences, des processus éprouvés et contrôles, et un resultat financier au bout du bout.
Or, chez Boeing, c'est défaillant à tous les stades du processus (BSC de Kaplan-Norton).
Lire plus Signaler guy bernard 14-09-2024 • 10h46 Boeing a pris le toboggan du déclin, et tout est lié...

author: Camryn Rabideau
title: Best Mops 2024 - Forbes Vetted
text:
While vacuums excel at picking up loose dirt, dust and debris from your floors, when it comes to tackling tough stains and scuff marks, the best mops are the ideal tool for the job. There are several types of mops that are popular today, including spray mops, spin mops and steam mops. However, for your everyday cleaning needs, our top recommendation is the O-Cedar EasyWring RinseClean Spin Mop , a user-friendly option that delivers a thorough clean on any flooring surface.
If you're questioning the necessity of a mop, especially if you vacuum regularly, experts say the answer is still yes: “If you have any sort of hard surface in your home for flooring, a mop is a must-have cleaning tool,” says Jessica Samson, cleaning expert for The Maids . “My favorite type of mop is a standard microfiber mop with a bucket that you can use on wet or dry surfaces. This makes it versatile to use on almost any kind of hard surface.”
Nevertheless, the most suitable mop for your home hinges on your cleaning requirements. In compact spaces, spray mops are frequently favored for their compactness and easy storage. Conversely, steam mops offer versatility by being effective on various surfaces, including glass and grout. For those seeking ultimate convenience, the best robot mops are available to handle the cleaning, efficiently scrubbing the floors while you enjoy a moment of relaxation.
Regardless of the mop style you seek, we’ve curated a selection of the best mops to help keep your home spick and span in 2024.
Best Mop Overall: O-Cedar EasyWring RinseClean Spin Mop Best Value Mop: Swiffer WetJet Spray Mop Best Mop For Hardwood Floors: Bona Hardwood Floor Premium Spray Mop Best Mop For Tile Floors: Black + Decker Steam Mop Best Steam Mop: Bissell PowerFresh Steam Mop Best Spin Mop: Libman Tornado Spin Mop System Best Robot Mop: Bissell SpinWave Pet Robot Best Oversized Mop: Microfiber Wholesale Store Professional Microfiber Mop Best Mop-Vacuum Combo: Tineco Floor ONE S3
Best Mop Overall A Popular Spin Mop With Clever Design Features
O-Cedar EasyWring RinseClean Microfiber Spin Mop & Bucket Buy From Amazon Type: Spin | Dimensions: 12.5 x 11.8 x 19.4 inches | Weight: 3.56 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
The bestselling O-Cedar EasyWring RinseClean Spin Mop delivers a quick and easy clean, making it one of the most popular options on the market right now. This cleaning system includes a microfiber mop and bucket, featuring a unique two-tank system that keeps clean and dirty water separate, preventing the spread of dirt on your floors. To remove excess water from the mop head, a simple push on the foot pedal allows it to spin.
Plus, the entire system is user-friendly and intuitive. The microfiber head of the O-Cedar mop is triangular, facilitating deep cleaning in corners, and it can be conveniently tossed into the washing machine for hands-off maintenance. Although the mop initially comes with a single cleaning head, the brand offers replacement units for those who prefer having backups. The only drawback is that the mop heads are relatively small, which might require a bit more time for cleaning larger areas.
Pros:
Bucket system provides clean water for rinsing Foot pedal makes it easy to wring out mop Triangular mop head fits into corners easily Mop head is machine washable Cons:
The mop head is smaller than others Best Value Mop A Simple Spray Mop That’s Surprisingly Effective
Swiffer WetJet Spray Mop Starter Kit Buy From Amazon Type: Spray | Dimensions: 11 x 5 x 46 inches | Weight: 3.23 pounds | Mop head type: Disposable
If you’re looking for a lightweight, compact mop for quick and convenient use, the Swiffer WetJet is an excellent choice. This affordable spray mop is a popular choice for quick cleanups, as it doesn’t require any water or buckets for operation. Instead, it features a container filled with cleaning solution that attaches directly to the mop. With the push of a button, you can dispense the solution onto your floors for efficient mopping.
The WetJet uses disposable mopping pads that easily adhere to the mop head. These pads boast high absorbency and a built-in scrubbing strip enables you to tackle stains and dried-on messes. After cleaning, simply discard the pad, however, keep in mind that you'll need to purchase replacement pads (as well as cleaning solution), and this may become a bit costly if you mop frequently.
Pros:
Lightweight and highly portable Pads have a scrubbing strip to help remove tough stains Disposable mopping pads make for easy maintenance Cons:
Replacement pads can add up Best Mop For Hardwood Floors A Spray Mop With A Special Hardwood Cleaning Solution
Bona Hardwood Floor Premium Spray Mop Buy From Amazon Type: Spray | Dimensions: 4.5 x 16.56 x 51.1 inches | Weight: 3 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
For homes featuring hardwood floors, the Bona Premium Spray Mop is one of the best options for preserving the wood's pristine appearance. This lightweight spray mop includes a specially formulated hardwood cleaning solution to keep your hardwood floors in top condition, and the cartridge is refillable, which helps to reduce plastic waste and decrease the cost of maintenance.
Equipped with a sizable 16-inch mop head, the Bona Spray Mop utilizes microfiber pads that effectively trap dirt while remaining gentle on hardwood surfaces. These pads are machine washable up to 500 times, and for added convenience, the brand offers multi-pack replacement pads if you prefer having extras on hand.
Pros:
Lightweight design with large mopping pad Comes with hardwood floor cleaner concentrate Cartridge is refillable to reduce waste Cons:
Spray nozzle can get clogged Best Mop For Tile Floors A Steam Mop That Includes A Grout-Cleaning Tool
Black+Decker Steam Mop Buy From Amazon Type: Steam | Dimensions: 12.8 x 7.3 x 25.4 inches | Weight: 8.5 pounds | Mop Head Type: Reusable
Cleaning tile floors, especially with recessed grout lines, can be challenging, but our research found that the Black+Decker Steam Mop is up for the task. While this versatile mop is designed for cleaning and sanitizing hard floors, it also transforms into a handheld steamer that’s equipped with a grout-cleaning brush for a thorough and deep clean. Additionally, the steam mop comes with a detail brush, squeegee and copper brush, making it a versatile tool for various cleaning tasks in your bathroom, kitchen and more.
As an added bonus, it’s effective in killing 99.9% of germs using steam alone, eliminating the need for additional cleaning solutions. Plus, it’s suitable for use on sealed stone, wood and laminate surfaces and with quick heat-up time of less than 30 seconds, it offers adjustable steam levels for different cleaning needs. Keep in mind that this model is corded, requiring proximity to an electrical outlet during operation.
Pros:
Converts from a mop to a handheld steamer Includes grout brush, as well as other attachments Heats up in less than 30 seconds Cons:
Corded design limits your range while cleaning Best Steam Mop A Powerful Steam Cleaner With Built-In Scent Discs
Bissell PowerFresh Steam Mop Buy From Amazon Type: Steam | Dimensions: 11.6 x 7.1 x 28.6 inches | Weight: 6.2 pounds | Mop Head Type: Reusable
The Bissell PowerFresh Steam Mop is a top-rated option for anyone who wants to clean without chemicals. It’s designed to clean and sanitize hard floors, killing 99.9% of germs and bacteria using hot steam alone. The mop comes with a soft microfiber pad and a more abrasive scrubbing pad, and it has a flip-down scrubbing tool that gets deep into grout lines and helps remove stubborn stains, as well.
The Bissell Steam Mop has three steam settings, and its 23-foot power cord provides enough range to clean most rooms. It also comes with two optional fragrance discs that you can insert into the mop to leave behind a refreshing scent as you clean.
Pros:
Cleans and sanitizes using just water Includes two reusable cleaning pads Flip-down scrubbing tool gets into grout lines Optional fragrance discs to leave behind a fresh scent Cons:
Water reservoir can be tricky to remove Best Spin Mop An Easy-To-Use Option With An Extra-Large Mop Head
Libman Tornado Spin Mop System Buy From Amazon Type: Spin | Dimensions: 14 x 14 x 53 inches | Weight: 5.44 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
You can quickly clean large areas with the Libman Tornado Spin Mop, which has an extra-large microfiber head. This comprehensive mopping system includes both a mop and bucket, and unlike conventional spin mops where the bucket spins, the Tornado stands out as the mop itself spins to wring out water. All you have to do is simply unlock the lever on the mop's handle and press down. The spinning motion effectively squeezes out excess liquid.
Noteworthy design features include a generous 2-gallon water capacity, a telescoping mop pole that can extend up to 53 inches for a more comfortable user experience, a large handle and pour spout for easy emptying and a machine washable microfiber head.
Pros:
Large mop head covers more area Mop head spins to wring out liquid Pole extends up to 53 inches Cons:
Plastic mop handle isn’t the most sturdy Best Robot Mop An Autonomous Robot Mop That Will Scrub Your Floors
Bissell SpinWave Pet Robot Buy From Amazon Type: Robot | Dimensions: 12.25 x 12.25 x 3.25 inches | Weight: 13.62 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
In our rigorous best robot mops testing, the Bissell SpinWave Robot came out on top as the most effective model. It features two rotating pads that effectively eliminate stains from various flooring types, employing a systematic back-and-forth pattern for a thorough clean. Notably, the robot autonomously avoids any carpeted areas during its operation. Simply fill its water tank, add a small amount of cleaning solution and let it take care of your floor cleaning needs.
For added versatility, the SpinWave Robot can be transformed into a robot vacuum by swapping out its water tank for a separate dustbin. While it can connect to the Bissell app on your phone, its smart features are more limited compared to other robot vacuums—primarily allowing you to start/stop the robot or create a cleaning schedule.
Pros:
Dual scrubbing pads are effective on tough stains Automatically avoids carpeting Doubles as a robot vacuum Cons:
Limited smart features Best Oversized Mop A Big Microfiber Mop To Clean Large Area
Microfiber Wholesale Store 18-Inch Professional Microfiber Mop Buy From Amazon Type: Flat | Dimensions: 18 x 1.8 x 41.2 inches | Weight: 1.95 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
For extensive cleaning tasks, the Microfiber Wholesale Store Professional Microfiber Mop stands out with its expansive 18-inch head, enabling you to cover more area in each pass. Built for heavy-duty use, it features a durable metal handle that telescopes up to an impressive 72 inches, allowing you to adjust it to your preferred height. The mop comes complete with both wet and dry mopping pads crafted from soft microfiber, securely adhering to the mop for stability during use. With a 360-degree swiveling head, you can effortlessly maneuver around furniture and obstacles.
However, it's worth noting that a potential drawback of this mop is the need to remove the entire pad if you wish to refresh it mid-cleaning, as the extra-large size may not fit into most buckets.
Pros:
18-inch mop head makes it easy to clean large areas Includes pads for wet and dry mopping Sturdy metal handle Cons:
Harder to wring out than other mops Best Mop-Vacuum Combo A Cordless 2-In-1 Floor Cleaner
Tineco Floor ONE S3 Cordless Floor Cleaner Buy From Amazon Type: Vac-mop | Dimensions: 11.3 x 10 x 43.3 inches | Weight: 9.92 pounds | Mop head type: Reusable
Typically, most cleaning routines involve vacuuming before mopping to handle larger debris, but the Tineco Floor ONE S3 breaks this pattern as it combines both vacuuming and mopping functionalities in one unit. The popular mop-vacuum has a cordless design that’s easy to drive around on hard floors, and it simultaneously sucks up dirt and other debris while mopping with its spinning brushroll. The unit incorporates separate tanks for clean and dirty water, offering a runtime of up to 35 minutes per charge.
The self-propelled design ensures easy maneuvering and the LED display provides real-time information on cleaning status and runtime. Equipped with sensors, the mop-vacuum detects both wet and dry messes, automatically adjusting suction for optimal performance. Additionally, it features a self-cleaning cycle that washes the brushroll and flushes out inner hoses when the mopping task is complete.
Pros:
Vacuums and mop simultaneously Self-cleaning design automatically cleans roller Self-propelled for easy maneuvering Cons:
Notably more expensive than most other mops MORE FROM FORBES VETTED The Best Bassinets, After Extensive Testing By A Mom And Her Newborn By Alexandra Frost Contributor The Best Swimsuit Brands That Fit Every Style And Budget By Kari Molvar Forbes Staff Why Trust Forbes Vetted The Forbes Vetted team brings substantial expertise in researching, writing about and testing cleaning tools, including the best mops. Our reviews on cleaning tools include the best robot mops , best steam mops , best vacuums , best carpet cleaners and more.
In addition to relying on our own expertise while putting together this list, we also consulted with cleaning expert Jessica Samson from The Maids, who shared valuable insights for selecting the optimal mop for your home. Furthermore, the author of this article, Camryn Rabideau , is a product tester with hands-on experience using several of the featured mops. And the story was edited by Sholeen Damarwala , an experienced home and kitchen editor on the Forbes Vetted team.
How We Chose The Best Mops Drawing on insights from our experts, we focused on identifying key features in the selection of the best mops for this list. Recognizing that mopping can be a laborious task, our priority was to highlight mops that streamline the process, offering features such as hands-free wringing, on-board cleaning solutions and/or machine-washable mop heads. We sought out products versatile enough for various floor types, assessing each pick based on criteria such as ease of use, special features and maintenance costs.

author: Elena Perry, The Spokesman-Review, Spokane, Wash.
title: West Valley School Board rules Spanish teacher overstepped when he read aloud the 'N-Word' in 'To Kill A Mockingbird', does not reinstate teacher | Tri-City Herald
text:
Washington State
West Valley School Board rules Spanish teacher overstepped when he read aloud the ‘N-Word’ in ‘To Kill A Mockingbird’, does not reinstate teacher
The West Valley High School Spanish teacher who read aloud the N-Word in a passage from "To Kill a Mockingbird" will not return to the school, the school board ruled at a crowded Wednesday morning meeting.
The board unanimously approved Superintendent Kyle Rydell's recommendation that Matthew Mastronardi's contract not be renewed following his reading of the racial slur in his Spanish class, where the text is not included in curriculum.
In April, Mastronardi overheard a group of his Spanish students talking about the text they're assigned to read in freshman English class and how their English teacher directed them not to read aloud the N-Word when encountering it in the text. Mastronardi chimed in that he would read each word as written, including the slur, and student Hayden Holdway invited him to "put his money where his mouth is, so to speak," Hayden said last week, handing Mastronardi his copy of the novel open to a page containing the slur. Mastronardi obliged, and one of his students recorded him without his knowledge.
"The fact that he would take it out of where it was supposed to be taught, and just overhearing the kids talk about it, he jumped in to make it a teachable moment, or try to make it a teachable moment," board President Pam McLeod said. "They weren't specifically asking him until after he engaged them. I feel that he inserted himself into the situation."
Mastronardi, in his final appeal to keep his job, asked the board to reinstate him, remove the discipline from his record and offer a job to his brother Andrew Mastronardi, who resigned an eight-year Spanish teaching position right across the hall from Matthew in a show of solidarity with his brother. Matthew Mastronardi doesn't regret his actions, he said.
"My lone violation is that I spoke a forbidden word while reading a book. Furthermore, I have the audacity to tell the truth to my students that they also can read from a book as written no matter what the color of their skin is," Matthew Mastronardi told the board. "It's your right and duty as a learner, but it certainly doesn't make you a racist."
Resoundingly, board members determined the text didn't belong in a Spanish classroom, absent of the care and guardrails put into teaching the text from the school's English department faculty, who have collectively decided not to use the word aloud when teaching.
"Our (English language arts) teachers at the high school, they work diligently to create a plan of learning and thoughtful intent within the lessons in an emotionally safe environment," board member Amy Anselmo said.
Matthew Mastronardi said as an educator, he had a responsibility to answer his students' "bold" questions regardless of his content area.
"To say that an educator needs to stick to the script is perhaps the most anti-educational statement I've ever heard in my entire life," he said.
Board members said they'd received emails from students in the class who were uncomfortable hearing the word read spontaneously. Parents of some students in Matthew Mastronardi's class, Anselmo said, had opted their kids out of reading "To Kill a Mockingbird" and were provided an alternative in line with district policy. Matthew Mastronardi didn't know who these kids were, and they were subject to the text outside of their own or their parents' wishes.
"There were students who opted out, or their parents opted out of the child reading, and then that was brought up in your classroom with you not knowing which student it was. It shows a lack of concern for the families," Anselmo said.
Matthew Mastronardi's X posts recounting the incident, including the 8-second video in which he can be heard reading the slur, racked up over 2.3 million views and garnered conservative media attention on a national scale, as well as local attention. Despite the virality of Matthew Mastronardi reading the passage with the slur, school board members indicated Wednesday that that wasn't the only rationale used in their decision not to renew his contract.
A provisional employee, state law allows school districts to not renew a teacher's contract within their first three years of employment for any reason.
"There have been complaints received by the district from parents and students about the lack of topic content in Mr. Mastronardi's Spanish class, and complaints about off-topic discussions regarding politics, religion," board member Robert Dompier said.
Natalie Willis-Collett, a parent of one of Mastronardi's students, said Matthew Mastronardi repeatedly discussed politics in his classroom, "consistently pushing his political agenda" to his students. Her main concern in the ordeal was Mastronardi allowing videographers from conservative education activist group Turning Point USA in their FRONTLINES series to enter the school to film an interview with Matthew Mastronardi in his classroom. A clip of her daughter was included in the video, fueling online bullying, she said. It's one of several appearances Matthew Mastronardi has made on conservative media outlets since his X post went viral.
"Mr. Mastronardi made the decision he made, and then, in response to the backlash, deliberately solicited an extremely conservative pseudo-journalist to come to the school and conduct an interview in an attempt to save his job," Willis-Collett told the board.
Willis-Collett was one of 29 speakers to address the school board Wednesday in more than an hour's worth of comment. All but a handful spoke in support of Matthew Mastronardi and his decision to read the word.
Matthew Mastronardi was a popular teacher at West Valley High School, several students said speaking in support of their "honest," "compassionate" and "caring" teacher. An online petition to reinstate Matthew Mastronardi, started by one of his pupils, garnered more than 2,500 signatures as of Wednesday. He's also started an online fundraiser that has raised $9,700 as of Wednesday.
"The way in which Mr. Mastronardi said these words aloud had no ill intent behind it, had no discriminatory intent behind it, and certainly no racist intent behind it," said Holdway, the student who prompted Matthew Mastronardi to read the text. "The context in which he said these words aloud was strictly academic while reciting excerpts from Harper Lee's famous piece of American literature."
Speakers raised concerns about freedom of speech and historical accuracy at the meeting. Heather Dalager told the board when she attended West Valley High School in the 1980s, her teachers read the word aloud, which added to the intent of the text against racism.
"We were taught the understanding of why the content of this book is so important to history," Dalager said. "We're supposed to learn from our mistakes, folks; we're not supposed to repeat them."
Spokane Valley Councilman Al Merkel and state Rep. Rob Chase spoke at the meeting in support of Matthew Mastronardi.
After the board unanimously decided not to renew Mastronardi's contract, an attendee began shouting at the board, "Shame on you!" and "Enjoy being replaced!" as Matthew Mastronardi approached Rydell to shake his hand.
Some attendees convened outside after the decision and Matthew Mastronardi addressed the crowd, thanking his students for their courage in defending him. Students gathered around Mathew Mastronardi, asking him for final lessons, to which he imparted, "God is good," "Serve the lord" and "Find out who truly loves you and surround yourself with those people."
Matthew Mastronardi said without his teaching job, he'll have more time to devote to his family and projects like raising chickens, as well as his podcast where he talks about "truth-seeking, about finding nuance in difficult, complex ideas that affect us today." He doesn't have another job lined up, but plans to continue educating, though "the medium will change," he said.
"When one door shuts, I believe that God opens another one," Matthew Mastronardi said.
Elena Perry's work is funded in part by members of the Spokane community via the Community Journalism and Civic Engagement Fund. This story can be republished by other organizations for free under a Creative Commons license. For more information on this, please contact our newspaper's managing editor.

author: kazpravda.kz
title: В Великобритании королевским астрономом впервые стала женщина
text:
В интервью Би-би-си она выразила надежду, что ее назначение в среду официальным советником короля Карла III по вопросам астрономии вдохновит женщин и девочек заниматься наукой, и добавила, что также хочет использовать свою новую должность, чтобы «открыть глаза людей» на чудеса космоса
Профессор Мишель Догерти не изучала естественные науки в средней школе, но однажды, воспользовавшись телескопом своего отца, она заинтересовалась космосом и решила узнать о нем побольше. Теперь она стала первой женщиной, назначенной королевским астрономом Великобритании за 350-летнюю историю этой должности, и входит в команду, отправляющую зонды к ледяным спутникам Юпитера, сообщает Kazpravda.kz со ссылкой на Bbc.com
«Я хочу взаимодействовать с общественностью, не только заинтересовать людей тем, чем мы занимаемся как астрономы, но также и объяснить, насколько важна наша работа для экономики Великобритании», — сказала профессор Догерти.
Профессор Догерти участвует в одной из самых захватывающих космических миссий на сегодняшний день: Европейское космическое агентство отправляет зонд к ледяным спутникам Юпитера, цель которого — оценить их пригодность для поддержания жизни.
«Было бы удивительно, если бы в нашей солнечной системе не было жизни», — сказала она со смехом, продемонстрировав свой неизменный энтузиазм.
В 10 лет она увидела Юпитер в телескоп, который она построила вместе с сестрой и отцом.
«Тогда я впервые увидела Юпитер и четыре его больших спутника и даже не думала, что когда-нибудь отправлю туда приборы на космическом корабле, — сказала она. — Мне приходится ущипнуть себя, чтобы поверить, что это не сон, и что я теперь королевский астроном!»
Назначение профессора Догерти любопытно еще и потому, что она не изучала естественные науки в средней школе в Южной Африке, где выросла.
«У меня был выбор между школами. В одной из них преподавали естественные науки, но никто из моих друзей туда не пошел, — сказала она. — В 13 лет я конечно решила, что хочу учиться с друзьями».
Но Догерти так хорошо давалась математика, что ее приняли на факультет естественных наук в университете.
«Первые пару лет было тяжело. Как новый язык учить», — сказала она.
Но вскоре она наверстала упущенное и приехала в Великобританию, где стала одной из ведущих ученых-астрономов.
«Я соглашалась на то, чего не умела, и училась по ходу дела», — рассказала она.
Должность королевского астронома восходит к созданию Королевской обсерватории в Гринвиче в 1675 году. Первым королевским астрономом стал Джон Фламстид из Дерби. В то время его работа в основном заключалась в том, чтобы консультировать короля по вопросам использования звезд для улучшения навигации в море.
Старший куратор обсерватории доктор Луиз Девой объясняет, что с годами эта должность эволюционировала и стала одной из самых важных в научной жизни страны.
«К 1800-м годам королевский астроном стал привлекаться в качестве правительственного советника, чтобы давать рекомендации по железным дорогам, мостам, телеграфии и целому ряду других вопросов, выходящих за рамки астрономии, — говорит она. — Если перенестись в XX век, то речь идет уже о развитии международного сотрудничества, поэтому британские астрономы работают на телескопах в Чили, на Канарских островах и даже на космическом телескопе Джеймса Уэбба».
За три с половиной века должность главного астронома всей Великобритании занимали 15 мужчин. Но в Королевской обсерватории в Эдинбурге с 2021 года аналогичную должность королевского астронома Шотландии занимает профессор Кэтрин Хейман. Она оценила назначение профессора Догерти: «Я очень рада, что теперь два королевских астронома в Великобритании — женщины, что отражает тот факт, что наука — это для всех».
Сама профессор Догерти не хочет придавать большого значения тому факту, что она стала первой женщиной, занявшей эту должность в Великобритании, но надеется, что это вдохновит других последовать ее примеру.
«Я считаю, что это важно. Когда дети видят кого-то, кто похож на них и занимается работой, которой, как им кажется, они никогда не смогут заниматься, это немного меняет их мировоззрение», — сказала она в интервью Би-би-си.
Профессор Догерти испытала это на себе, когда возглавляла физический факультет Имперского колледжа в 2018–2024 годах. За это время доля первокурсниц, поступивших в колледж, выросла с 19% до 25%.
«Это не огромное число, — сказала она, — но тренд положительный. И я думаю, это произошло потому, что студенты увидели, что я занимаю должность, к которой они могут стремиться в будущем».

author: laSexta Clave
title: El precio de trabajar para Elon Musk: precarias condiciones de seguridad y jornadas de más de 80 horas semanales
text: Lo pagan en salud El precio de trabajar para Elon Musk: precarias condiciones de seguridad y jornadas de más de 80 horas semanales Elon Musk, el magnate conocido por su visión de [colonizar el espacio](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/asi-sera-primer-paseo-espacial-privado-tripulantes-dos-millonarios-viajan-bordo-nave-elon-musk_2024091166e1f20d3c87870001824dc5.html) y revolucionar la industria automotriz, también es el rostro de unas condiciones laborales extremadamente duras en sus empresas. En SpaceX, la compañía que busca llevar a la humanidad más allá de la Tierra, se han registrado siete veces más accidentes laborales que el promedio del sector, incluyendo aplastamientos, electrocuciones y amputaciones. Estos incidentes reflejan un entorno de trabajo peligrosamente descuidado, que pone en riesgo la salud y seguridad de sus empleados. Además, Musk ha demostrado un claro desprecio por los sindicatos y por la unión de los trabajadores. Se enorgullece de sus largas jornadas de trabajo, que a menudo superan las 80 horas semanales, mientras sus empleados enfrentan condiciones que podrían parecer inaceptables en cualquier otro lugar. Por otro lado, la relación de Musk con el dinero público añade una capa de hipocresía a su discurso ultraliberal. Aunque aboga por la mínima intervención del Estado y la eliminación de ayudas públicas, sus empresas han recibido significativas subvenciones gubernamentales. Tesla, su empresa de vehículos eléctricos, ha recibido enormes cantidades de dinero público para su desarrollo. SpaceX, el mayor contratista de la NASA, ha captado más de 15.300 millones de dólares en subsidios desde 2003. Este contraste plantea serias preguntas sobre el verdadero pensamiento de Musk respecto al dinero público y las ayudas estatales. Más Noticias [35 años del asesinato de Carmen Tagle, la primera fiscal española asesinada por ETA](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/35-anos-asesinato-carmen-tagle-primera-fiscal-espanola-asesinada-eta_2024091266e33f6fb3741e0001e35a6f.html) [Laura Loomer, la activista de extrema derecha que difunde teorías conspirativas y ataca a Kamala Harris](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/laura-loomer-activista-extrema-derecha-que-difunde-teorias-conspirativas-ataca-kamala-harris_2024091266e33ddefcf7b3000159a49e.html) [¿Kamala Harris o Donald Trump? El PSOE lo tiene claro, pero el PP guarda silencio](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/kamala-harris-donald-trump-psoe-tiene-claro-pero-guarda-silencio_2024091266e33d60b3741e0001e35657.html) [España quiere mejorar el sistema público de bicicletas, ¿están Madrid, Barcelona o Castellón preparadas?](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/espana-quiere-mejorar-sistema-publico-bicicletas-estan-madrid-barcelona-castellon-preparadas_2024091266e33cc6b3741e0001e35508.html) [Así será el primer paseo espacial privado: los tripulantes (dos millonarios) viajan a bordo de una nave de Elon Musk](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/asi-sera-primer-paseo-espacial-privado-tripulantes-dos-millonarios-viajan-bordo-nave-elon-musk_2024091166e1f20d3c87870001824dc5.html) Este viernes, a las 21:30 en [laSexta Columna](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/sexta-columna/chantajearme-dinero-que-jodan-asi-respondio-elon-musk-anunciantes-que-dejaron-tuit-antisemita_2024091266e305063c87870001dd76a6.html), se profundizará en estos temas, revelando el costo humano y financiero detrás de los ambiciosos proyectos de Musk. Un problema grave [El 9% de la población bebe alcohol a diario y un tercio fuma, pero el PP se resiste a las reformas necesarias](https://www.lasexta.com/programas/lasexta-clave/9-poblacion-bebe-alcohol-diario-tercio-fuma-pero-resiste-reformas-necesarias_2024091166e1ed7dfcf7b300015713f7.html) A pesar de la evidencia y la eficacia de medidas como el control de alcoholemia y las leyes antitabaco, el Partido Popular ha mostrado una resistencia persistente a implementar reformas más estrictas para abordar estos problemas.

author: Peter Atencio
title: Run 7-Eleven lures 40,000+ participants - Manila Standard
text: The night-time footraces of the Run 7-Eleven 2024 have attracted some 40,000-plus participants. The cool evening weather is expected to boost runners when competitions begin at 10 p.m. in the cities of Manila, Iloilo and Cagayan de Oro on Feb. 3. Familiar faces like Richard Salano, Jeson Agravante, Mary Joy Tabal, Christine Hallasgo, Nhea Anne Barcenas are expected to return and grace the various distance events of the weekend meet as they seek out podium finishes. Last year, Salano and Agravante took the top honors in the men’s and women’s 21-km run of the Manila leg, while Hallasgo ruled the women’s 21-km event in Davao City. In Cebu, Rio de Janeiro Olympian Mary Joy Tabal marked her return to running from marriage and motherhood, with a third-place finish to winner Asia Paraase and Jeanly Mata in the women’s 16-km run. “We have been doing this for the longest time. And it’s really been a privilege for the 7-Eleven Run Series to be part of Manila, the heart of where everything started,” said Jose “Jun” Ang, Jr., the Division Head of General Merchandising of Philippine 7-Eleven Corporation, chief organizer of the race, which is on its 12th year. The refreshing conditions of the evening are favorable to the runners, who will have a chance to go around the routes with a better pace, according to organizers, who discussed the mechanics of races during the event’s launch on Friday at the Aristrocrat Restaurant in Malate, Manila Cash prizes will be at stake to the overall winners of the men’s and women’s 42-km run, the men’s and women’s 21-km events, along with the top finishers of the men’s and women’s 32-km action. The podium finishers will also be given a chance to join in top-notch running events around the Southeast Asian region. Organizers said they have achieved success in their registrations, with 25,000 participants already confirmed in the City of Manila, while 8,000 are set to compete in Iloilo, and 7,000 are joining in Cagayan de Oro. The winners in the 42-km marathon will get P25,000, while the top notchers in the 32-km category will receive P22,000. The champions of the 21-km action will be given P20,000.

author: Pachita Rex
title: OMS emite recomendaciones ante el primer caso de encefalitis equina en 20 años
text:
Internacional OMS emite recomendaciones ante el primer caso de encefalitis equina occidental en 20 años. Foto de La Nación OMS emite recomendaciones ante el primer caso de encefalitis equina en 20 años
La OMS emitió recomendaciones tras el primer caso de encefalitis equina occidental en un ser humano del que se tiene noticia en más de 20 años
diciembre 28, 2023 La Organización Mundial de la Salud (OMS) emitió varias recomendaciones tras conocerse el primer caso de encefalitis equina occidental en un ser humano del que se tiene noticia en más de 20 años, diagnosticado a una persona adulta en la provincia argentina de Santa Fe .
El paciente fue hospitalizado el 24 de noviembre después de varios días en los que mostró síntomas como dolores de cabeza, mialgias, desorientación y fiebre, por lo que tuvo que recibir ventilación mecánica durante doce días, y fue dado de alta el 20 de diciembre, cuando Argentina notificó el caso a la OMS .
La enfermedad, muy rara en humanos (con casos reportados en Argentina en los años 1982-83 y 1996), se desarrolla principalmente en caballos y el país del Cono Sur ha reportado mil 182 brotes en estos animales desde el 25 de noviembre al 27 de diciembre, 717 de ellos en la provincia de Buenos Aires .
La OMS recuerda que el virus puede transmitirse de animales al hombre a través de las picaduras de mosquitos, por lo que ha recomendado la eliminación de zonas con agua contaminada que puedan servir de vivero de insectos y la colocación de mallas protectoras contra ellos en viviendas y establos.
El organismo también recomendó fortalecer la vigilancia en zonas con brotes activos en animales.
Según la OMS , las personas con mayor riesgo de contraer esta enfermedad son aquellas que trabajan en zonas con esos brotes activos y trabajan o participan en actividades en el exterior.
Pese a lo notificado, la OMS subraya que los casos en humanos han sido hasta ahora muy aislados, con síntomas moderados o asintomáticos, si bien alertó de que no existe tratamiento antiviral.
Con información de EFE

author: Jaron Spor
title: David Pollack Names College Football Superstar That Is The New 'Benchmark'
text:
David Pollack Names College Football Superstar That Is The New ‘Benchmark’
Each year, a new star emerges and captivates the college football world. This star may be a veteran who has improved every season and is finally getting their moment in the spotlight, or it could be a rising young player ready to make a name for themselves. One of those standout players this season has been Jeremiah Smith, a true freshman wide receiver for the Ohio State Buckeyes. According to several recruiting outlets, he was the nation’s top player in the 2024 class. Smith has done nothing but live up to that as he has accumulated 1,224 yards and scored…
Read more at athlonsports.com
